author: Special Correspondent
text:
Superintendent of Police N. Manivannan has ordered construction of permanent sheds with lighting, fan and CCTV facilities for policemen deployed on round-the-clock duty at all check posts in the district.

The tin-sheet sheds, each costing around Rs. 1.5 lakh, would be built at 14 check posts established inside and on the borders of the district, the SP said on Thursday.

There were 18 check posts in the district, 12 on the borders and six inside the district, he said.

The check posts near Pioneer hospital, Pattinamkathan, Kannirajapuram and Parthibanur had permanent sheds and the new sheds would be established at 14 other check posts in the next six months, he said.

The sheds would have lighting and fan facilities for the benefit of policemen who take duty on turns, he also said.

The department also proposed to install CCTV cameras at all check posts for better surveillance, he said.

Two cameras, facing either side of the road would be installed and the policemen on duty could monitor and record movements of vehicles in the closed circuit television sets inside the sheds, the Superintendent of Police added.

At any given time, two policemen would be on duty at the check posts, he said.
title: Permanent sheds for policemen manning check posts
